title: Class vs. Object Visual
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Computer Science
description: Interactive cookie-cutter analogy that contrasts a Dog class with the Dog objects it instantiates.

learningObjectives: Differentiate between the shared structure of a class and the unique attribute values of each object instance.
prerequisites: Understands variables and functions in a beginner language (Python or Java)
Has seen or written a simple class definition

keyQuestions: What stays the same between every Dog object that comes from the Dog class?
Where do an object's specific name, breed, and age live?
commonMisconceptions: Believing that changing one object's data changes the class for all objects
Thinking that methods belong to individual objects instead of the class definition
assessmentOpportunities: Prompt students to narrate the instantiation arrow for a new dog they create
Ask students to match attribute/value pairs to the correct cookie after hovering the tooltip
